instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3332: What is 820-3332? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U8900: What is U8900? This chip creates the GPU power rails on the 820-3332 board to the 2012 and early 2013 15‚Äù Retina Macbook Pros. It becomes desoldered and is the cause of no video and kernel panics/crashes in that model most of the time..

threads.title: MacBook Pro Retina Early 2013 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Powers on bot won't load any OS
threads.message:
MacBook Pro Retina Early 2013 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Powers on bot won't load any OS

Even with external SSD it tries to load but shutsdown right after, holing the Alt key at the start brings up the drive boot menu but as soon as you select any HD including ASD one it shuts down, sometimes when it does load the OS it gets really really hot.

threads.title: MacBook Pro Retina Early 2013 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Powers on bot won't load any OS
threads.message:
Reflow/resolder <CHIP>U8900</CHIP>.
Change it, if still the same.
After that, only remains GPU as culprit.
See if pass all ASD EFI tests.

threads.title: MacBook Pro Retina Early 2013 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Powers on bot won't load any OS
threads.message: Thanks will try, right now it is not even giving me the boot option or should anything on screen after power on.
